alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 4:32PM MST until August 11 at 5:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 432 PM MST, Runoff from earlier thunderstorms in the area continues to pose a threat to life and property, especially at Archibald Wash over Pierce Ferry Road where cars continue to be stranded. Several other washes in the warned area are likely seeing flooding impacts as 1 to 2 inches of rainfall occurred in this area over the last several hours. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Area observations and Flood Control Webcams IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dolan Springs, Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads, Packsaddle Campground, Windy Point Campground and Chloride. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
